critique: This executive order establishes the White House Gender Policy Council and directs the federal government to advance gender equity and equality. It covers a wide range of issues, including economic opportunity, healthcare, education, and gender-based violence. It also emphasizes the importance of considering the unique experiences of women and girls who are members of other underserved communities. The order promotes diversity and inclusion and aims to combat systemic biases and discrimination. It also terminates a previous working group focused on women's global development and prosperity. The order itself doesn't directly expand executive power, but it does create a council within the executive branch to coordinate and advance gender equity and equality. It also directs agencies to review their policies for consistency with the strategy developed by the council. The order does not directly address immigration or national security. It focuses on gender equity and equality, which aligns with liberal values. It also promotes government intervention to address gender disparities, which aligns with a liberal approach to economic regulation. The emphasis on diversity and inclusion also aligns with liberal values.
